meanings.definition: To make or become fat or fatter.
meanings.sent1: She fattened the cat with extra treats.
meanings.sent2: The farmer fattened the pig for the county fair.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a salad after a workout seemed to have fattened her imagination.
meanings.sent4: His wallet fattened with each successful investment.
meanings.sent5: The clouds fattened with rain before the storm.

meanings.definition: To feed an animal in order to make it fat.
meanings.sent1: The farmer fattened the chickens with corn.
meanings.sent2: They fattened the cows before selling them at market.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons fattened themselves on the ripe berries in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel fattened up for winter by hoarding nuts.
meanings.sent5: The bear fattened itself on the salmon swimming upstream.

meanings.sent1: As winter approached, the bear fattened up for hibernation.
meanings.sent2: The stray cat fattened quickly after being adopted.
meanings.sent3: The balloon fattened as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent4: The population of the town fattened over the years.
meanings.sent5: The river fattened as the snow melted and fed into it.
